FuncDef:
The ip netstream mpls exclude command disables MPLS packet sampling on an interface.
The undo ip netstream mpls exclude command enables MPLS packet sampling on an interface.
By default, MPLS packet sampling is enabled on an interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you do not need to sample MPLS traffic on an interface, run the ip netstream mpls exclude command to disable MPLS packet sampling on the interface.
If you need to sample MPLS traffic on an interface, run the undo ip netstream mpls exclude command to enable MPLS packet sampling on the interface.
Precautions
When the last ip netstream { inbound | outbound } command configuration is deleted from an interface, the ip netstream mpls exclude command configuration is also deleted from the interface.
